body: \text{List the things of beauty mentioned in the poem.}
\text{List the things that cause suffering and pain, as described in the poem.}
\text{What does the line ‘Therefore are we wreathing a flowery band to bind us to earth’ suggest to you?}
\text{Explain why ‘grandeur’ is associated with the ‘mighty dead’ in the poem.}
\text{Describe the image the poet uses to depict the beautiful bounty of the earth.}
\text{Identify and explain the complaint the city folk have about the roadside stand.}
\text{What was the plea of the people who had set up the roadside stand?}
\text{Discuss how the government and social service agencies appear to help the poor rural people but end up doing more harm.}
\text{Explain the ‘childish longing’ the poet refers to in the poem and why it is ‘vain’.}
\text{Identify and analyze the lines that convey the insufferable pain the poet feels for the rural poor.}
\text{How do the words ‘denizens’ and ‘chivalric’ enhance our understanding of the tigers’ attitude?}
\text{Explain why Aunt Jennifer’s hands are described as ‘fluttering through her wool’ in the second stanza.}
\text{What is suggested by the ‘massive weight of Uncle’s wedding band’ in the poem?}
\text{Interpret the significance of Aunt Jennifer’s ‘ringed ordeals’. What does the word ‘ringed’ imply?}
\text{Analyze the symbolic differences between Aunt Jennifer and the tigers she creates in her art.}
\text{What is the significance of the title ‘Keeping Quiet’?}
\text{What does the poet mean by ‘not move our arms so much’?}
\text{Explain the concept of introspection as presented in the poem.}
\text{What are the positive effects of silence according to the poet?}
\text{Discuss how the poet’s call for silence is also a call for peace.}
\text{What is the significance of the title ‘The Tiger King’?}
\text{Describe the prophecy made at the birth of the Tiger King.}
\text{How did the Tiger King try to prove the prophecy wrong?}
\text{Explain the irony in the death of the Tiger King.}
\text{What is the author’s view of power and obsession as portrayed in ‘The Tiger King’?}
\text{Describe the author’s journey to Antarctica and what it signifies.}
chapter_name: Journey to the End of the Earth

body: \text{What does the author mean by saying that Antarctica is ‘the coldest, driest, windiest continent’?}
chapter_name: Journey to the End of the Earth

body: \text{Explain how Antarctica serves as a time capsule of past climate changes.}
chapter_name: Journey to the End of the Earth

body: \text{Discuss the significance of the author’s observation about the beauty and fragility of the Earth.}
chapter_name: Journey to the End of the Earth

body: \text{How does the journey to Antarctica affect the author’s view of human impact on Earth?}
chapter_name: Journey to the End of the Earth

body: \text{Discuss Dr. Sadao’s conflicting feelings regarding the American prisoner.}
\text{Why did Dr. Sadao decide to treat the wounded prisoner despite the risks involved?}
\text{Explain how Dr. Sadao’s profession influenced his actions throughout the story.}
\text{How did Dr. Sadao’s wife, Hana, react to the presence of the prisoner in their home?}
\text{What does the story ‘The Enemy’ reveal about human values and prejudice?}
\text{Discuss the character of Mr. Lamb and his outlook on life.}
\text{How does Derry’s attitude change after meeting Mr. Lamb?}
\text{Explain the significance of the title ‘On the Face of It’.}
\text{Describe the themes of isolation and friendship as depicted in the play.}
\text{What lessons does Derry learn from Mr. Lamb about facing life’s challenges?}
\text{Summarize the experiences of Zitkala-Sa as described in the story.}
\text{What are the main issues discussed in ‘Memories of Childhood’?}
\text{Explain how Zitkala-Sa’s cultural identity is impacted by her experiences.}
\text{Discuss the theme of oppression and resistance as presented in ‘Memories of Childhood’.}
\text{What does the story convey about the impact of cultural assimilation on indigenous identities?}
\text{What are the views of V. S. Naipaul regarding the impact of interviews on privacy?}
\text{Describe the role of interviews in modern journalism as discussed in the chapter.}
\text{What are the different perspectives on interviews provided by Umberto Eco and Lewis Carroll?}
\text{Discuss how interviews can both reveal and distort the truth about a person.}
\text{Analyze how interviews affect the image and reputation of public figures.}
\text{Describe Sophie’s dreams and aspirations as presented in the story.}
\text{What does the story reveal about the nature of adolescent fantasy?}
\text{How does Sophie’s family react to her dreams and fantasies?}
\text{Discuss the role of social and economic background in shaping Sophie’s aspirations.}
\text{Analyze the theme of reality versus illusion in the story.}
\text{What was Franz’s attitude towards school at the beginning of the story?}
\text{Why did the villagers come to the school on the day of the ‘last lesson’?}
\text{How does M. Hamel explain the importance of the French language to the villagers?}
\text{Discuss the impact of the Prussian order on the people of Alsace.}
\text{What emotions does Franz experience during the ‘last lesson’? Explain.}
\text{Describe the living conditions of Saheb-e-Alam in ‘Lost Spring’.}
\text{What is ironic about Saheb’s name? Explain.}
\text{Discuss the symbolism of ‘spring’ in the context of the story.}
\text{How does the story depict the issues of child labor and poverty?}
\text{What is Mukesh’s dream, and why is it significant in the story?}
\text{Describe the incident at the Y.M.C.A pool that almost drowned Douglas.}
\text{What psychological impact did the near-drowning incident have on Douglas?}
\text{Discuss how Douglas eventually overcame his fear of water.}
\text{Explain the significance of the title ‘Deep Water’.}
\text{What lessons did Douglas learn from his experience of conquering his fear?}
\text{How does the peddler view the world, and what metaphor does he use to describe it?}
\text{Describe the interaction between the peddler and the ironmaster.}
\text{Explain how Edla’s kindness changes the peddler’s view of himself and the world.}
\text{What message does the story ‘The Rattrap’ convey about human nature?}
\text{Analyze the significance of the letter the peddler leaves for Edla.}
\text{Discuss the significance of Champaran in the context of the Indian independence movement.}
\text{What were the problems faced by the peasants of Champaran?}
\text{Explain how Gandhi’s approach in Champaran exemplified the principle of nonviolent resistance.}
\text{How did Gandhi’s involvement in Champaran change the outlook of the local peasants?}
\text{Discuss the impact of the Champaran episode on Gandhi’s future role in the independence movement.}
\text{Describe the role of the Gemini Studios in the Indian film industry as presented in ‘Poets and Pancakes’.}
\text{Explain the function of the makeup department in Gemini Studios and its unique practices.}
\text{Discuss the author’s views on Subbu’s character and his influence at the studios.}
\text{What was the impact of the visit by the poet and editor from England on the people at Gemini Studios?}
\text{Analyze the tone and style of the author in ‘Poets and Pancakes’.}
